(Scabbard and Blade Journal, vol. 8, no. 3, Feb. 1934)
My Sword, my Sword, my Bonny Blade,
I fetch thee from the sheath.
Bellona Place upon thy hilt
Mar's incarnadine wreath.
My Sword, my Sword, my comrade Blade,
That bears a comrade's part;
Sheens within the Battle's Pall
And sheaths in foemen heart:
My Sword, my Sword, my Flashing Blade,
Shaming the silvery stars.
Valor shall weave our warrior crown
Above the throne of Mars.
My Sword, my Sword, my Trusted Blade.
Thy soul of vibrant steel
That havoc brings unto our foes
And to our comrades, weal.
My Sword, my Sword, my Trenchant Blade.
That guards me night and day.
Nor counts a Legion more than one
Where Gods at Battle play.
My Sword, my Sword, Brilliant Blade,
That hews our pathways wide,
Crimsoning all the verdant hills
And dyes the ocean's tide.
My Sword, mY Sword, my Gallant Blade,
My Pride, my Love, my Breath—
Till thou shall break we will not fail
Our tryst with Hell and Death.

THE REAR - GUARD
(By Siegfried Sassoon)
Groping along the tunnel, step by step,
He winked his prying torch with patching glare
From side to side and sniffed the unwholesome air.
Tins, boxes, bottles, shapes too vague to know,
A mirror smashed, the mattress from a bed;
And he, exploring fifty feet below
The rosy gloom of battle overhead.
Tripping, he grabbed the wall; saw someone lie
Humped at his feet, half-hidden by a rug,
And stooped to give the sleeper's arm a tug.
"I'm looking for headquarters." No reply.
"God blast your neck." (For days he'd had no sleep.)
"Get up and guide me through this stinking place."
Savage, he kicked a soft, unanswering heap,
And flashed his beam across the livid face
Terribly glaring up, whose eyes yet wore
Agony dying hard ten days before;
And fists of fingers clutched a blackening wound.
Alone he staggered on until he found
Dawn's ghost that filtered down a shafted stair
To the dazed, muttering creatures underground
Who hear the boom of shells in muffled sound.
At last, with sweat of horror in his hair,
He climbed through darkness to the twilight air,
Unloading hell behind him step by step.

THE REAR - GUARD
(By Siegfried Sassoon)
Groping along the tunnel, step by step,
He winked his prying torch with patching glare
From side to side and sniffed the unwholesome air.
Tins, boxes, bottles, shapes too vague to know,
A mirror smashed, the mattress from a bed;
And he, exploring fifty feet below
The rosy gloom of battle overhead.
Tripping, he grabbed the wall; saw someone lie
Humped at his feet, half-hidden by a rug,
And stooped to give the sleeper's arm a tug.
"I'm looking for headquarters." No reply.
"God blast your neck." (For days he'd had no sleep.)
"Get up and guide me through this stinking place."
Savage, he kicked a soft, unanswering heap,
And flashed his beam across the livid face
Terribly glaring up, whose eyes yet wore
Agony dying hard ten days before;
And fists of fingers clutched a blackening wound.
Alone he staggered on until he found
Dawn's ghost that filtered down a shafted stair
To the dazed, muttering creatures underground
Who hear the boom of shells in muffled sound.
At last, with sweat of horror in his hair,
He climbed through darkness to the twilight air,
Unloading hell behind him step by step.
